description.narrative: The Capacity Building for Women#s Equality in Natural Resources Management is an Australian NGO Cooperation Partnership (ANCP) - funded project through Oxfam#s Mekong Regional Gender Program. In Lao PDR, the project aims to increase the understanding of civil society (local Civil Society Organisations, INGOs, Lao Women#s Union-LWU) regarding the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW) as well as its significance for gender equity and women#s empowerment, including their role in CEDAW monitoring. The project thereby facilitates links between Lao women#s rights networks and regional peer groups. In a context where civil society is still weak, it is anticipated this would open and facilitate channels for policy dialogue between government and civil society and create more visibility for women in all key decision-making processes. The project#s support to partners has included technical capacity-building and engagement in local, national and regional learning events. In-turn, this has contributed to achieving identified outcomes in the longer term, such as: improved skills and capacities of the LWU at the central, provincial and district levels in monitoring the impact on gender equity in investment in natural resource development; and to creating the space for further collaboration between the relevant departments, CSOs, development donors and the private sector on capacity-building initiatives for gender equity and women#s empowerment.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
